CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice with call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C21

TI_TEXT.P: Услуги на линейки по транспортиране на пациенти

TITLE.P: Provision of Ad hoc Ambulance Services to Transfer Low and Medium Acuity Patients Between Healthcare Facilities

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Contracting Authority is issuing this request for applications to participate in order to establish Panels for the provision of ad hoc ambulance services to transfer low and medium acuity patients between healthcare facilities (the “Panel”) for use by the Panel Clients. In summary, the Services comprise the provision of: (i) Ad hoc ambulance services to transfer low and medium acuity patients between healthcare facilities in accordance with Pre-Hospital Emergency Care Council’s standards (the “PHECC Standards”); and, or, (ii) Dedicated ambulance services, within a specific geographic area or attached to a specific facility, to transfer low and medium acuity patients between healthcare facilities in accordance with PHECC Standards. This public procurement competition (the “Competition”) will be divided into 8 lots (each a “Lot”) as described in the Tender Documentation. Each Lot will result in a establishment of a separate Panel.

TITLE.P: Lot 1: Fingal, Meath, Louth, Cavan and Monaghan

SHORT_DESCR.P: In summary, the Services comprise the provision of:

(i) Ad hoc Ambulance Services to Transfer Low and Medium Acuity Patients Between Healthcare Facilities, in accordance with Pre-Hospital Emergency Care Council’s standards. Tenderers should note that the scope of services is not limited to normal working hours; and, or,

(ii) Dedicated Ambulance Services to Transfer Low and Medium Acuity Patients Between Healthcare Facilities within a specific geographic area or attached to a specific facility in accordance with PHECC Standards.
In Lot 1: Fingal, Meath, Louth, Cavan and Monaghan.

INFO_ADD.P: Please note that the Lot Value is a Best Estimate of value over five years. The HSE has a higher confidence in the overall Tender Value.

The Services shall be awarded under Part 3 – Particular Procurement Regimes, Chapter 1 - Social and other specific services of the European Union (Award of Public Authority Contracts) Regulations 2016 (the “Regulations”). The Services are listed as Annex XIV services, and accordingly, only Regulations 74 to 77 of the Regulations apply to the award of a contract that may arise from this Competition.
Regulation 74 relates to the award of contracts for social and other specific services.
Regulation 75 relates to publication of notices related to this chapter.
Regulation 76 relates to principles of awarding contracts related to this chapter.
Regulation 77 relates to related contracts for certain services referred to in Regulation 74.
Annex XIV services are not subject to any other formal rules of the Regulations.

Accordingly, as this is an Annex XIV service, Candidates should not assume that this Competition will be aligned with the standard procedures set out in the Regulations and elements of all the standard procedures may be used. For the avoidance of doubt, the Contracting Authority reserves the right to invite comments and submissions from Candidates during the process. In addition, the Contracting Authority may engage in confidential discussions with Candidates as part of this process.
